name: bake
tagline: builds and concatenates static websites from a list of templates
body:
![bake](https://raw2.github.com/gcraig/bake/master/img/bake.png)

### bake is ruby-based
'bake' will assemble a web site given the specified build file (usually bakefile.json); concatenating the header/footer for each page set.

### to do:
- include pre- and post- hook scripts for customization
- include publishing to various deployments (ftp, dropbox, etc.)
- check-in, push automatically
- version number increment and auto-label
- cross-language compilation
- verbose output
- capture to log

```
Options:
  -e, --version     outputs version and exit
  -f, --file        bakefile (if specifying build file other than bakefile.json)
  -h, --help        displays this help and exit
  -p, --push        pushes website out to destination (-d required if bakefile.json not present)
  -d, --dest        destination [protocol:server:uid:pwd]
  -v, --verbose     outputs debugging information
  -w, --helloworld  outputs example site
  -l, --log <file>  captures all output to file
```

### sample bakefile.json
```
{
    /* bakefile.json - example build file */
    "exclude_files" : "",
    "pre_execute" : "",
    "post_execute" :  "",
    "output_dir" : "website",
    "static_dir" : "static",
    "header": "header.html",
    "footer": "footer.html",
    "pages" : ["index.html", "home.html"],
    "flags" : {
        "publish" :
        {
            "publish" : "true",
            "archive" : "true",
            "publish_server" : "ftp.server.com",
            "publish_type" : "ftp",
            "uid" : "uid",
            "pwd" : "pwd"
        }
    }
}
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
